entry.title: Common Linux Commands
entry.summary: Understand a Command $ man command for manual pages $ command --help for help Run at Background The screen command launches a terminal in the background which can be detached from and then reconnected to. You can start a screen, kick off a command, detach from the screen, and log out. You can then log in later and reattach to the screen and see the program running. startup $ scre...
